query_text: How do I apply for a Skilled Worker visa?
documents: To apply for a Skilled Worker visa, you need a job offer from a UK employer with a valid sponsor licence. The job must meet the required skill level (RQF level 3 or above) and salary threshold of £38,700 per year or the 'going rate' for the job, whichever is higher.
You must complete the online application form on GOV.UK and pay the visa fee. You'll also need to pay the immigration health surcharge as part of your application.
Book a biometric appointment at a visa application centre to provide your fingerprints and photograph. You'll need to attend this appointment within 90 days of starting your application.
The Skilled Worker visa is a type of work visa that allows you to come to the UK if you have a job offer from an approved employer.
Visa application centres are located in major cities around the world. Check the GOV.UK website for your nearest location.

query_text: What documents do I need for Skilled Worker visa?
documents: You must provide a valid Certificate of Sponsorship from your UK employer. This is a unique reference number that contains information about your job and sponsor.
Proof of English language ability is required unless you are exempt. You can prove this with an approved English language test or a degree taught in English.
Financial evidence showing you have at least £1,270 in savings for 28 consecutive days before applying, unless your sponsor certifies maintenance on your Certificate of Sponsorship.
A valid passport or travel document is required for all visa applications to the UK.
Your criminal record certificate from any country you've lived in for 12 months or more in the past 10 years may be required depending on your job role.

query_text: Can I switch from student visa to Skilled Worker?
documents: You can switch from a Student visa to a Skilled Worker visa while in the UK. You don't need to return to your home country to apply.
To switch, you must have a valid job offer from a licensed sponsor and meet all Skilled Worker visa requirements including the salary threshold of £38,700 or the going rate.
You should apply before your current Student visa expires. The earliest you can apply is 3 months before your start date with your new employer.
A Student visa allows you to study in the UK at an approved institution. You can work part-time during term time (up to 20 hours per week) and full-time during holidays.
When switching from Student to Skilled Worker, you'll need to provide your Certificate of Sponsorship, proof of English, and evidence you meet the salary requirements.

query_text: What is the minimum salary for Skilled Worker visa?
documents: The general salary threshold for a Skilled Worker visa is £38,700 per year. However, some jobs have a different 'going rate' based on occupation codes.
You must be paid at least the higher of £38,700 per year or the going rate for your occupation code. Going rates vary by job and are listed in the Immigration Rules Appendix Skilled Occupations.
New entrants (under 26 years old, recent graduates, or in certain occupations) can be paid 70% of the going rate or £30,960, whichever is higher.
Healthcare and education workers may have different salary requirements. Check the specific rules for your occupation on GOV.UK.
Salary is calculated based on basic gross pay (before tax) for a 37.5 hour working week. Overtime and bonuses are not included.

query_text: How long does Skilled Worker visa processing take?
documents: If you're applying from outside the UK, you'll usually get a decision within 3 weeks. Priority services are available for faster processing.
If you're applying from inside the UK (switching from another visa), the standard processing time is 8 weeks from your biometric appointment.
You can pay for priority service (5 working days) or super priority service (next working day) for an additional fee if applying from within the UK.
Processing times may be longer during peak periods or if your application requires additional checks for security or other reasons.
You'll be notified by email when a decision has been made on your application. You can then collect your biometric residence permit.

query_text: What is indefinite leave to remain?
documents: Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) allows you to live and work in the UK permanently without time restrictions. It's also known as 'settlement' or 'permanent residence'.

You can apply for ILR after holding a Skilled Worker visa for 5 years continuously. You must meet residency requirements including not spending more than 180 days outside the UK in any 12-month period.
ILR holders have the right to work without restrictions, access public funds, and apply for British citizenship after holding ILR for 12 months.
To apply for ILR, you must pass the Life in the UK test and meet English language requirements at B1 level.
Once granted, ILR does not expire, but you should apply for a new biometric residence permit every 10 years to prove your status.

query_text: Can my family come with me on Skilled Worker visa?
documents: Your partner and children under 18 can apply as your dependants when you apply for a Skilled Worker visa. They'll need to apply separately but at the same time.
Dependants can work and study in the UK without restrictions. They don't need separate work authorization.
Each dependant must pay the visa fee and immigration health surcharge. They'll also need to prove your relationship (marriage certificate, birth certificates, etc.).
If you later want to bring family members after you've arrived in the UK, they can apply to join you as dependants at any time during your visa validity.
Dependants can apply for ILR at the same time as you, provided they've been in the UK for the required period and meet the residency requirements.
A Certificate of Sponsorship (CoS) is a virtual document with a unique reference number assigned by your UK employer. It contains information about your job, salary, and sponsor details.
Your employer must have a valid sponsor licence from the Home Office to issue a Certificate of Sponsorship. Not all employers are licensed sponsors.
There are two types: defined CoS (for workers applying from outside the UK) and undefined CoS (for workers switching from within the UK).
The CoS is valid for 3 months from the date of issue. You must use it to apply for your visa within this time or it will expire.
Your employer assigns the CoS to you electronically. You don't receive a physical certificate - just the reference number which you enter in your visa application.

query_text: How much is the immigration health surcharge?
documents: The immigration health surcharge (IHS) is £1,035 per year for most visa applicants. You pay this upfront for the full length of your visa.
Students and their dependants pay a reduced rate of £776 per year. Health and care workers on the Health and Care Worker visa are exempt from the charge.
For a 3-year Skilled Worker visa, you would pay £3,105 (£1,035 × 3) as part of your visa application.
The IHS gives you access to the National Health Service (NHS) in the UK, the same as a UK resident. You can use NHS services without additional charges.
If your visa application is refused, you'll get a refund of the IHS but not the visa application fee.
